frameDefinitions: A Questioner asks a Witness (or defendant) questions in the context of a court procedure.
An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.
An Evader moves under its own power to thereby avoid Capture  or contact with a Pursuer, also generally moving under its own power.
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.

An Agent or Potential_hindrance keeps a Protagonist from having a State_of_affairs that they need or desire, or, despite the possibility of preventing the possession, they allow the Protagonist to have the State_of_affairs.
frameExamples: We 'd like to <t>cross-examine</t> the witness if we can.
I saw that several men in dark suits had <t>removed</t> all of the evidence from the scene.
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
His parents <t>deprived</t> him of food for days on end.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual who asks a <fen>Witness</fen> questions.
A person who is present in a courtroom in order to give some form of evidence, has been sworn in, and is being examined by a <fen>Questioner</fen>.
When the examination occurs.
Where the examination takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
Theme is the object that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before it changes location.
The non-Agentive cause of the removing event.
The time at which the removal takes place.
The location where the removal takes place.
The <fen>Evader</fen> moves under its own power to <fen>Capture</fen> or contact with the <fen>Pursuer</fen>. Normally the <fen>Evader</fen> frame element is expressed as an external argument.
The <fen>Pursuer</fen> is going after the <fen>Evader</fen> unless they act.
An actual or hypothetical  event in which the <fen>Pursuer</fen> takes physical control of the <fen>Evader</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the Evading occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not prevent it.
The  is the situation, state-of-affairs, or state of having a possession that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is kept from having.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the  person who keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the person who is kept from having the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
listRoleExamples: You have leave to examine <fex>the witness.</fex>
<fex>The waiter</fex> removed the dishes from the table.
The waiter removed <fex>the dishes</fex> from the table.
The waiter removed the dishes <fex>from the table</fex>.
<fex>The raging fire</fex> quickly emptied the square of all people.
<fex>That year</fex> they drained the swamp-water out of Higgs' bottomland.
You just take the dishes and rinse them <fex>in the kitchen</fex>, okay?
<fex>The mouse</fex> eluded the cats for only a few minutes.
The mouse eluded <fex>the cats</fex> for only a few minutes.
Rýmirez-Sýnchez , tried in absentia , had evaded <fex>capture</fex> since the murders in Paris on June 27 , 1975
Smithers got away <fex>at the stroke of midnight</fex>.
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.
You will also be graded <fex>on your speed of response</fex> .
<fex>The study</fex> evaluated the risk of a major quake.
<fex>This chapter</fex> evaluates the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .
The committee rated Smithers ' most loyal servant ' <fex>about a week ago</fex> .
They 'll evaluate you <fex>in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .
<fex>Israeli law</fex> effectively deprived the owners of their homes and lands.
Their parents denied them <fex>a brand new car</fex> upon their sweet 16.
<fex>The uncaring King Frank</fex> often starves his citizens of tax relief.
